name: Daniel Reeves
bio: Hello! I'm Daniel Reeves, a Boston-based product designer with over a decade experience. My road has been a bit unique, starting with a PhD in physics and including a stint designing and building delightful interactive multimedia installations. My passion for aesthetics and human-centricity informs both my design work and my hobbies. I'm currently looking for my next challenge in product design!

as a sections.title: Designer
as a sections.text: I'm a product and program designer for all sorts of cross-functional teams. I excel at bringing a structured and analytical approach, honed through my Ph.D. training, to bear on complex problems to find intuitive solutions and communicate them clearly to diverse audiences. I listen, think, and always advocate for the user.

as a sections.title: Scientist
as a sections.text: Through my dissertation and two post-docs, I brought multiple disciplines and points of view together to understand problems at many scales. One common thread, shared across contexts of biology, chemistry, and geophysics, was building an understanding of how molecules interact in crowded environments. For publication list, visit https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Daniel-Reeves-2.

as a sections.title: Hobbyist
as a sections.text: I enjoy woodworking, gardening, and playing with my cat. I like coaxing beautiful shapes and textures from the raw natural materials of wood and soil.

additional sections.text: The code for this website is available on GitHub as the open-source platform WhisperWork. I built it to be easy to use for non coders, and easy to update and customize, as it is completely configurable from json files.
